oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of women at a festival, President Hoover and his running mate, President Coolidge's son, and six ads. Nashville Banner, 1928 July 1.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Boyd, Annie Bruce; Hoover, Herbert; Curtis, Charles; Coolidge, John; Webb, Ronald; Webb, Donald
Nashville Banner
Beauty contestants; Presidents; Children
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of women at a festival in Asheville, North Carolina (one of whom is from Knoxville, Tennessee), President Hoover and his running mate as candidates, President Coolidge's son in graduation garb, and six ads, one of which features children who reside at 113 North Greenway Avenue. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: P. & A. Photo
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
